["PhD or equivalent Master's Degree plus 4+ years of experience in CS, CE, ML or related field", '2+ years of experience of building machine learning models for business application', 'Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language', '
', '
', 'Amazon’s Advertising Analytics and Insights (A&I) team is looking for a motivated and experienced Applied Scientist to pioneer new ways to analyze the needs, experiences, and behaviors of Amazon consumers at petabyte scale. We are a "startup" within one of the fastest growing and most strategic parts of Amazon. Analytics & Insights owns the product, technology and deployment roadmap for advanced analytics and insights products across our advertiser success team. Advertiser success is core to Amazon’s growth, as it helps our suppliers drive awareness, consideration, and purchase of their products by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world, and generates revenue which helps us lower prices and invest in improvements to our customer experience. We are a highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving team with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.', '
', '
You will be part of the team developing a new tool that helps advertisers understand customers who interact with their brands on Amazon Search leading to marketing strategy and campaign optimization decisions that can grow their brand. These insights also enable brands to track brand performance over time and stay on top of search trends. In this role, you will take a leading role in defining the problem and our approach to the solution. You will join a new and growing team of top-notch technical professionals working to develop and evaluate new advertising metrics based on petabytes of data. You will innovate on behalf of our customers by prototyping, delivering functional proofs of concept (POCs), and partnering with our engineers to productize and scale successful POCs. If you are passionate about creating the future, come join us as we work hard, have fun, and make history.', '
', '
', 'Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Amazon EMR, Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena', 'Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment', 'Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations', 'Understanding of common advertising metrics and KPIs']

['The ', 'Big Data Developer', ' will play a key role at DRVN Intelligence Inc., required to help create and maintain industry-leading quality and efficiency of service and software delivery.', '
', '
DRVN Intelligence Inc. will rely on the Big Data Developer to support the Data Systems team, in both data engineering and data science-related workflows. The Big Data Developer will be expected to meet and exceed DRVN Intelligence’s quality standards while helping the organization rapidly adopt DevOps frameworks and practices, and expand complex Machine Learning and related applications.', '
', '
Key Responsibilities:', '
', '
Development Responsibilities:', '
', '
', 'Development Best Practices and Skills/Procedures Advancement for the DRVN Intelligence Data Systems team:
', 'Establishing, maintaining and evolving Development and Developer Operations (DevOps) best practices and tools, and continuously keeping them aligned with current industry best practices and procedures', '
', 'Understanding, implementing and automating security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation frameworks', '
', 'Championing deployment tooling within the DRVN Intelligence team, with tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, etc.', '
', 'Championing version control technology frameworks and creating/implementing working processes within the Data Systems team, with tools such as Git or SVN', '
', 'The Big Data Developer will be the primary individual responsible for DRVN Intelligence’s adherence to Development and DevOps best practices, and required to continuously innovate and evolve related systems and working processes', '
', 'Code Productization:
', 'Migrating the delivery of the most common/universally applicable solutions from custom projects to formally productized software solutions', '
', 'Championing and advocating for building repeatability, scalability and standardization into how the DRVN Intelligence Data Systems team approaches all work, in order to enable the future migration to productization as a general rule', '
', '
', 'Data Engineering-Specific Responsibilities:', '
', '
', 'Participate in the continuous delivery pipeline to fully automate deployment of the highly available cloud platform that supports multiple projects', '
', 'Design and develop ETL workflows and datasets to be used in data visualization tools', '
', 'Write complex SQL queries with multiple joins to automate and manipulate data extracts', '
', 'Perform end to end Data Validation to maintain accuracy of data sets', '
', 'Build tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
', 'Troubleshoot and resolve issues in the development, test and production environments', '
', 'Develop re-usable processes that can be leveraged and standardized for multiple instances', '
', 'Prepare technical specifications and documentation for projects', '
', 'Stay up to date on relevant technologies, plug into user groups, understand trends and opportunities to ensure we are using the best possible techniques and tools', '
', 'Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation', '
', 'Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate operational processes', '
', '
', 'Data Science-Specific Responsibilities:', '
', '
', 'Perform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns from historical data, generate and test hypotheses, and provide product owners with actionable insights', '
', 'Design experiments for product initiatives and perform statistical analysis of the results with recommendations for next steps and future experiments', '
', 'Create and design dashboards by using different data visualization tools to present reports and insights, and support business decision making', '
', 'Help the DRVN Intelligence Data Systems team adopt and evolve Predictive Modeling, Machine Learning and Deep Learning processes to deliver to clients in the future', '
', '
', 'Company-Wide Responsibilities:', '
', '
', 'Maintain client satisfaction and happiness with DRVN Intelligence Inc.’s deliverables, day-to-day work and overall value as a partner', '
', 'Help identify, pitch, cultivate, prepare and deliver material as needed for new business and business development initiatives', '
', 'Cultivate opportunities for company growth, always be looking for areas where DRVN Intelligence Inc.’s role could be expanded or built upon', '
', 'Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations', '
', 'Maintain dedication toward achieving excellence in DRVN Intelligence Inc.’s delivery against client needs, and overall success as an organization']

['The Condominium Authority of Ontario (CAO) was launched on September 1, 2017 and remains focused on empowering Ontario’s growing condominium communities. This includes condo owners, directors, residents, buyers, managers, industry professionals and the public.', '
', '
We are a non-crown, not for profit corporation that operates under the Condominium Act, 1998 (the Act) and an administrative agreement with the Minister of Government and Consumer Services (MGCS). We are not funded by tax dollars, but by fees paid by all condo corporations and Condominium Authority Tribunal (CAT) users.
', 'We support consumer protection, and we strive to enhance our value to condo communities through our suite of digital resources and services. This includes:', '
', ' Easy-to-use resources in English and French to help condo communities understand their rights and responsibilities under the Act', '
', ' Free online tools, including Guided Steps to Common Issues, to help resolve issues collaboratively before they escalate into disputes', '
', ' Clear and cost-effective online dispute resolution through the Condominium Authority Tribunal (CAT) – Canada’s first fully online tribunal', '
', ' Free and mandatory training for condo directors to help them understand their role and legal obligations', '
', ' Digital condo returns and notices of change where corporations can file and update information', '
', ' A searchable Public Registry, containing information from every condo corporation in Ontario', '
', ' An integrated Information Services team that responds to all telephone and email inquiries to help members better understand the legal and governance framework behind condo communities', '
', '
', '
PURPOSE OF POSITION:', '
', '
Working in the Strategic BI and Data Analytics department and reporting to the Director, the role will support building a data and insight-driven organization. The role will apply knowledge and experience of analytics and data modelling to solve challenging business problems through innovative solutions. This position will work in collaboration with other areas across the organization including technology, information services, finance and communications, the Condominium Authority Tribunal (CAT) team, and the CEO’s office.
', 'If you have demonstrated experience with data management, analytics, data visualization and are constantly seeking better ways to do things, learning new tools and have a passion for leveraging the value of data, this exciting opportunity could be for you!!', '
', '
The position will be for a one (1) year term.', '
', '
', '
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:', '
', ' Extract, explore, and manipulate data from various sources and formats to appropriately prepare data and data models for developing actionable insights and any other form of data-driven intelligence and analytics', '
', ' Develop data governance rules, establish and automate data monitoring and provide feedback to business/technology areas for continuous improvement of data quality
', ' Identify and acquire new data sources, perform data discovery to understand data values and relationships and develop solutions to deliver business value', '
', ' Generate BI content in the form of visualizations, dashboards, reports and analytic models to optimize decision-making across the organization
', ' Respond to ad hoc data requests, reports and insights using analysis and self serve dashboards to respond to requests from CAO departments, senior executives, stakeholders and board members', '
', ' Interpret and analyse data from multiple sources, synthesize, identify issues and trends and recommend actions
', ' Apply business-relevant analysis, statistical and machine learning approaches to solve challenges and make recommendations using predictive analysis', '
', ' Support development of performance metrics by analyzing data sources and trends to recommend baselines and targets
', ' Monitor and report on performance metrics, trend values and outcomes and recommend improved data collection strategies including survey development and exploration of new data sources', '
', '
', '
Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge', '
', ' Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in science, business, or social science', '
', ' A minimum of 3-5 years of demonstrated experience with BI, data manipulation and data science tools and their application (Tableau, Informatica, Power BI, SQL, Python, VBA, Crystal Reports, R, API programming/connectivity, Databricks, etc.)
', ' Experience developing business insights from social, client and time series data using advanced machine learning techniques', '
', ' Experience analyzing structured and unstructured datasets to develop insights from large volumes of data', '
', ' Ability to handle conflicting work demands from multiple projects and deliverables', '
', ' Strong problem-solving skills and ability to break down complex problems and articulate creative solutions', '
', ' Critical thinking skills to understand business and convert to conceptual data models and inform analysis', '
', ' Ability to distill most impactful business relevant results, summarize the data analysis, and convey the business insights and implications of the results', '
', '
', '
Technology Skills:', '
', ' Expertise in developing dashboards, visualizations and analysis using tools like Informatica, Power BI, Tableau, SPSS etc.', '
', ' Expertise in coding with at least one scripting language, e.g. python and a statistical/ analytics software tool such as R', '
', ' Expertise in data manipulation and integrity checking for a variety of data types to transform data for reporting and analytics', '
', ' Experience with data modelling and logic of how data models are built', '
', ' Experience with data architecture, data integration/ extraction, transformation and loading (ETL), data warehousing, and/or BI deployment on Azure cloud', '
', ' Experience with use of machine learning tools for analysis and automation', '
', ' Understanding of building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing and times-series analysis', '
', ' Understanding of big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function', '
', '
', '
DISCLAIMER:', '
', '
We thank everyone for their interest in joining our dynamic team. Only those qualified and selected for an interview will be contacted.
', 'CAO is an equal opportunity employer, encouraging workplace diversity. All qualified individuals will be considered without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.', '
', '
CAO welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.', '
', '
', '
Closing Date: 16 March 2020']

['Here at Rakuten Kobo Inc. we offer a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to have healthy minds and bodies. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities.', '
', '
If you’re looking for a company that inspires passion, personal, and professional growth – join Kobo and come help us ', 'make reading lives better.', '
', '
The Role:', '
Rakuten Kobo Inc. are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Big Data team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Analytics, you will be part of a diverse, flexible, and collaborative environment where you will be able to work with unique and exciting data and directly impact the business on a daily basis.', '
', '
The Responsibilities:', '
Leverage the large amount of data collected in our ecosystem, from our: website, partners, apps, and eReaders to further our mission of making reading better for all.', '
Apply your knowledge of statistics, experimental design and A/B testing to help business & product owners to make sound decisions based on meaningful data.', '
Use your engineering expertise to evolve, modernize, and improve the performance and reliability of our data collection, aggregation, and analysis pipelines.', '
Work with the BigData and Data Engineering team to tackle complex data & processing challenges.', '
Present your findings to audiences of various technical backgrounds.', '
Opportunities to expand into machine learning and other data science initiatives.', '
Technical Requirements', '
B.Sc. In Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or related field', '
5+ Years of SQL experience', '
3+ Years of Python experience (Pandas, NumPy)', '
1+ Years of BigData Environment (Hadoop, Spark, Hive)', '
1+ Years using Data Visualization Tools (Tableau, Domo, Matplotlib)', '
Working knowledge of the Unix shell environment', '
Bonus Points', '
Experience using large datasets in eCommerce or marketing analysis', '
Experience using job orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi)', '
Familiarity with statistical tools such as R', '
A passion for beautiful data visualizations', '
Excellent communication and presentation skills', '
', '
The Perks:', '
Flexible hours and no office dress code', '
Pooch Program that allows you to bring your furry friends to the office', '
Full benefits starting from your first day', '
Paid Volunteer days, unlimited sick days, and 3% RRSP matching', '
Monthly commuting allowance', '
Flexible health spending account', '
Talent and development training budget', '
Free Kobo device + free weekly e-book or audiobook', '
Frequent Lunch and Learns Author series', '
Weekly Kobo Tech University sessions', '
Onsite gym', '
Weekly happy hours (Thirsty Thursdays, as we like to call it)', '
Maternity/paternity leave top up', '
', '
About Rakuten Kobo Inc.', '
Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the most advanced global ecommerce companies, with the world’s most innovative eReading services offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to 30 million + customers in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies.', '
', '
Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.', '
', '
Rakuten Kobo would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this role however only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.', '
', '
Rakuten Kobo will never ask you to pay or deposit any money as part of working with Kobo. Similarly, Kobo will never ask in an email or online for your banking information or any government information about you, such as social security information. If you encounter these fraudulent attempts, please send an email to [kobo-security]@rakuten.com with the relevant information, and do not respond to the sender. All legitimate emails from Kobo are sent only from the domain @rakuten.com.']

['We are now looking for a Senior Deep Learning Applied Scientist - AI Applications.
', 'Join an ambitious team that is looking beyond the current landscape of AI to ask the fundamental question: "How can we automate the understanding of human language?" Our goal is to radically improve the capability of computers to understand human meaning across healthcare, finance, gaming, robotics, and automotive. We are seeking research staff to contribute to this important effort. Our mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in Language Understanding, Speech Recognition and Synthesis, Multi-modal Scene Understanding, and Conversational AI. In everything we do, we strive to achieve outstanding computational performance by working with the latest hardware and advanced deep learning software tools. We collaborate closely with engineering and research groups across the company and our work influences NVIDIA hardware and software roadmaps. As members of the global research community, we frequently publish in top venues and collaborate with academic groups around the world.
', "What you'll be doing:
", 'Develop and prototype new Deep Learning models and training algorithms for speech recognition, speech synthesis, NLP, dialog systems, visual Q&A, and other areas in conversational AI.
', 'Transfer your technology to NVIDIA’s software product teams. We also often release our work as open source
', 'Collaborate with deep learning & AI researchers in leading universities and industrial research labs
', 'Publish your original research. Present to conferences and customers.
', 'What we need to see:
', 'Possess a PhD, or have equivalent experience in Computer Science or a related field, with 10+ years of professional experience
', 'Advanced understanding of Deep Learning with applications in conversational AI and multi-modal scene understanding, with a consistent track record of publications or significant product contributions in these areas
', 'A strong mathematical background, especially in the optimization theory, stochastic algorithms, and/or numerical methods with a passion for solving hard math problems
', 'Strong C++ and Python programming skills and experience with Tensorflow or PyTorch
', 'Excellent communication and interpersonal skills along with the ability to work in a dynamic, product oriented, global team.
', 'Your history of mentoring other scientists and interns is a huge plus.
', 'Ways to stand out from the crowd:
', 'Previous product development experience in commercial software or major open source projects.
', 'Systems software engineering knowledge and expertise in optimizing software for computational performance.
', 'Demonstrated expertise in CUDA, parallel programming, or GPU Computing
', 'NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of technology’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working with us. Are you creative and autonomous? Does the idea of turning ground breaking research into a shipping product excite you? If so, we want to hear from you!
', '#deeplearning']

['We are now looking for a Research Scientist Intern – Deep Learning
', 'NVIDIA is searching for a world-class researcher to join our research team. We are interested in deep learning, reinforcement learning, semi-supervised and unsupervised learning, but are also considering other areas of machine learning. You would work within our new research team in machine learning and collaborate with existing teams that cover computer vision, image processing, graphics, natural language processing, and more.
', "What you'll be doing:
", 'Design and implement machine learning techniques.
', 'Publish original research.
', 'Collaborate with other team members.
', 'Speak at conferences and events.
', 'Transfer technology to product groups.
', 'Collaborate with external researchers
', 'What we need to see:
', 'Pursuing a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, or a related field.
', 'Excellent knowledge of theory and practice of machine learning.
', 'Knowledge of common machine learning frameworks.
', 'Track record of research excellence.
', 'Strong publication record (NIPS, ICML, AAAI, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, etc).
', 'Excellent communications skills.
', 'Ways to stand out from the crowd:
', 'Knowledge of application areas, such as computer vision or natural language processing.
', 'Excellent programming skills in some rapid prototyping environment such as MATLAB or Python; C++ and parallel programming (e.g., CUDA)
', 'Intelligent machines powered by AI computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Today, a self-driving car powered by Artificial Intelligence can meander through a country road at night and find its way. An AI-powered robot can learn motor skills through trial and error. This is truly an outstanding time.
', 'Image recognition and speech recognition — GPU deep learning has provided the foundation for machines to learn, perceive, reason and solve problems. The GPU started out as the engine for simulating human imagination, conjuring up the amazing virtual worlds of video games and Hollywood films. Now, Nvidia’s GPU runs deep learning algorithms, simulating human intelligence, and acts as the brain of computers, robots and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Just as human imagination and intelligence are linked, computer graphics and artificial intelligence come together in our architecture. Two modes of the human brain, two modes of the GPU. This may explain why Nvidia GPUs are used broadly for deep learning, and Nvidia is increasingly known as “the AI computing company.”
', '#deeplearning']

['Teranet is the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration. We developed, own and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System - one of the most advanced, secure and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. In Manitoba, Teranet owns and operates The Property Registry, providing certification of titles to land, maintains land records and offers reliable information of financial interests in personal property to the public. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System.
', 'Job Description
', 'The Data Science Specialist is responsible for the execution of our Commercials Solutions data strategy governing a broad portfolio of products within the Value Added Solutions business.
', 'The incumbent will be primarily responsible for developing new data solutions and enhancing existing data solutions to key customers and partners; delivering exists data solutions per customer contracts; supporting sales team for customer inquiries; supporting marketing team with data analytics content and samples. In addition, the Data Science Specialist plays a key role in acquiring more and better data, enhancing data quality, and enhancing the accuracy of the products supported (such as valuation algorithm accuracy). This individual will support the development of productive long-term relationships with a variety of external parties including municipal and provincial governments as well as corporate data partners.
', 'Specific Responsibilities
', 'Innovation
', 'Developing new data solutions and enhancing existing data solutions to key customers and partners
', 'Work closely with the Leader, Data & Analytics, and sales & marketing teams to
', 'Identify customer needs and define customer requirements
', 'Create and deliver new market insights and data analytics prototype
', 'Define requirements for new data infrastructure and associated tools
', 'Data Operations
', 'Deliver exists data solutions per customer contracts
', 'Define data quality operational standards to improve operational efficiencies with multiple 3rd party sources
', 'Recommend data normalization and standardization best practices to improve customer experience.
', 'Implement data quality metrics with appropriate internal / external reporting
', 'Preparation and maintenance of data-related processes and procedures
', 'Sales/Partner Support
', 'Support inquiries from sales team and other internal partners (e.g. marketing & finance) to drive revenue growth
', 'Examples include:
', 'Provide domain expertise in data and data products to support sales team
', 'Support the preparation of RFI/RFP proposals
', 'Provide AVM (Automated Valuation Model) update requests
', 'Generate necessary data reports and activity reports for clients
', 'Provide content and data samples to marketing team
', 'Qualifications ', ':
', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
', 'Preferably Master Degree in the field of Business Analytics, Statistics or Quantitative Analysis
', 'At least 3-5 years working experience in data engineering, IT or data analytics
', 'Experience with various data analytic tools such as R, SAS, VBA and Python
', 'Knowledge and experience with economic forecasting, descriptive and predictive analysis models
', 'Good communicator with strong written and oral communication skills
', 'Ability to conduct external market research
', 'Teranet Inc. is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please inform us of any accommodation requirements you may require.']

JOB TITLE: ['Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Computer Vision, Deep Learning and SLAM']
JOB DECSRIPTION: ['Position Description', 'Area: ', ' Computer Vision and Deep Learning', 'Duration: ', ' 2 years', 'Starting Date: ', ' April 1st, 2020', 'Salary: ', ' $60,000 - $80,000 plus York University’s standard benefit package', 'Dr. Gunho Sohn’s Lab (www.yorku.ca/~gsohn) in the Department of Earth and Space Science and Engineering at York University in Toronto is opening Multiple Postdoctoral Fellowships to work on the development of deep learning methods for computer vision and SLAM. The successful candidates will work on an exciting project to develop an innovative pipeline for 3D semantic mapping and SLAM using mobile laser point clouds and images. This is a collaborative project with Teledyne Optec in Toronto (https://www.teledyneoptech.com/en/home/), the world leader in the development and manufacture of advanced fully-integrated lidar and camera solutions in ground-based, airborne and spaceborne mapping systems.', 'Research Areas: ', ' The application of deep learning to automatic generation of 3D semantic maps using the sheer amount of mobile mapping data is a rapidly growing area of research and the successful applicant will be expected to develop novel techniques to address the unique challenges posed by image understanding and mapping in complex urban environments.', 'Applicants for Postdoctoral Fellowship will have demonstrated expertise in computer vision and machine learning, with particular experience and educational background in one or more of the following areas: ', 'Deep Learning;', 'Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM); and', '3D Computer Vision;', 'Required Qualifications', 'Doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years.', 'Proven publication record in computer vision, machine learning and photogrammetry research.', 'Programming experience in Python and/or C++.', 'Experience with one or more of TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.', 'Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral.', 'The candidate should have a doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years and demonstrate proven publication record in computer vision and machine learning research. ', 'The position is for two years. The salary for this position is competitive and the starting date is April 1st, 2020.', 'Research Environment: ', ' Dr. Sohn’s lab is located in Lassonde School of Engineering at York University (https://lassonde.yorku.ca/) and Centre for Research in Earth and Space Science (CRESS) (http://cress.info.yorku.ca/). Research interests include the development of 3D primitive based urban modelling and augmentation, autonomous mapping and navigation and digital infrastructure modelling. The postdoctoral fellow will be working with faculty and graduate students in several research programs led by York University:', 'NSERC CREATE Data Analytics & Visualization (https://www.createdav.com/welcome/)', 'Intelligent Systems for Sustainable Urban Mobility (http://issum.yorku.ca/)', 'Advanced Disaster, Emergency and Rapid Response Simulation (http://adersim.info.yorku.ca/)', 'Vision: Science to Application (http://vista.info.yorku.ca/).', 'To Apply: ', 'Please submit a brief statement of research interests, a curriculum vitae and a list of publications and contact information for 2-3 references (not letters required at this stage).', 'Information ', 'about Dr. Sohn’s lab at York University can be found at www.yorku.ca/~gsohn. Following Canadian Employment and Immigration guidelines, applicants must be eligible to', 'work in Canada.', 'Reference ID: Postdoc Fellowship in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, SLAM', 'Contract length: 24 months', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Experience:', 'Deep Learning: 2 years (Preferred)']

", 'Summary:
', '
Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (ML and AI) is a strategic initiative in risk management. The candidate will participate in new projects and be hands-on along side internal experts. The candidate will have a concrete and meaningful contribution to the final deliverables and is expect to show autonomy and ownership of their deliverables.
', '
', '
The candidate will be responsible for identifying AI and ML use cases in the Risk Capital and Model Development group and building these models in partnership with the existing team. This will cover multiple areas such as Anti-Money Laundering, Credit Risk, Economic Capital etc.
', '
', '
The candidate will also be working on identifying automation opportunities where existing processes can be enhanced and simplified using AI.
', '
', '
The role also has a technology component where the candidate will participate in the assessment of the current risk technology stack and test and validate assumptions on new tools.
', '
', '
', 'Description:
', '
', 'Use case identification:
', 'Expand on the currently identified use cases by partnering with the existing model development groups and the business partners and identify other types of models/applications where ML and AI can add value. This will cover areas such as credit risk, economic capital, AML and market risk.
', '
Structure above identified use cases, define operating model, manage delivery and provide
', '
', 'Data collection and manipulation
', 'Collect data for model development purposes by identifying new candidate variables and predictive variables.
', '
Analyze and summarize data to identify outliers and assess data quality.
', '
Perform data imputation using advanced statistical techniques (multiple imputation, machine learning estimations).
', '
Transform and prepare the data for developing AI models.
', '
', 'Predictive models development
', 'Fully understand the existing version of the models where applicable, their limitations and all the underlying assumptions made.
', '
Use the prepared data to build machine learning predictive models using advanced regression techniques such as random forests, neural networks, boosted trees, deep learning, logistic regressions, NLP etc
', '
Rank and compare the candidate models to select the best fitting models.
', '
Use statistical tests to ensure the stability and robustness of the candidate models.
', '
Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning in the current model development process.
', '
', 'Reasonableness assessment
', 'Ensure that the models developed make business and intuitive sense by participating in sessions with the model owners, lines of businesses and including their feedback in the model.
', '
Design a process to explain the output of the models on a consistent basis to understand why the models are producing these decisions.
', '
', 'Documentation
', 'Document the process along the way by capturing the details around all assumptions made.
', '
Keep record and detailed notes about the thought process. The models developed will serve as a proof of concept for future ML & AI models in credit risk.', '
', '
Skills required:
', '
Master or PhD candidate in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related quantitative field.
', '
5-10 years of experience in AML, risk management and machine learning and AI techniques
', '
Familiarity with risk management processes and methodologies, ideally AML
', '
Familiarity with Bank credit instruments and product structures
', '
Familiarity with systems management and data architecture principles
', '
Experience with statistical model development and data mining
', '
Proven experience using SAS, R or Python to build machine learning models
', '
Strong theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques and advanced regression methods and data imputation techniques
', '
Well-developed relationship management skills.
', '
Excellent influencing and negotiation skills
', '
Strong problem solving skills and capacity to turnaround analysis in short period of time
', '
Comfortable in a challenging environment with tight timelines
', '
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
', '
Capacity to cope with a high degree of ambiguity and change
', '
Ability to work both independently and as part of cross-functional teams
', '
Prior industry experience or academic projects with machine learning and advanced programming is preferred.
', '
High-level of competency with MS Office suite of tools

The Manager Data Integration and Advanced Analytics is a key member of the broader Data Science and Products team and will be responsible for driving project and adhoc based actionable insights to drive key KPI’s. The manager will have a hands on role utilizing a variety of tools SAS, SQL, Python to explore and understand data and provide visualizations (Power BI/ Tableau) to tell key business partners a story with recommended actions to drive outcomes. The data attributes include (but not limited to) revenue, subscribers and product/tier changes which needs to be analysed at different contexts like customer-level analysis and program-level analysis. Hands on working with data to pull data, turn the data into a story that can share insights with business partners to drive key KPI’s is the key part of this role.', '
', '
The role will also be responsible to work with various business partners including Brand and Digital to build Segmentation and audiences using a variety of digital tools including Adobe, Google and AWS product suite.', '
', '

', '
Lead analytical requests for both project and ad-hoc data analytical requests and build comprehensive visualizations (PowerBI and Tableau)
', 'Use SQL, SAS. Python to analyze data from different sources and provide key actionable insights', '

Partner with various Rogers Business teams to align business logic to make available consumable qualitative data to drive key KPI’s', '
Lead digital projects for segmentation using Adobe, Google, AWS suite of products', '
', '

', '
7 years hands-on experience in Data Analysis, SAS, SQL programming, Python and Data visualization with the ability to think analytically', '
Strong development and visualization skills (PowerBI, Tableau etc.) and power point presentations that enable leaders understanding of data to provide actionable insights that enables functional leaders in decision making
', 'Strong digital experience working with Adobe, google, AWS data suite of products', '
Understanding of Data Science and feature engineering
', 'Self-motivated person with desire to go above and beyond tasks', '
Being pro-active when it comes to exploring opportunities for growth and improve programs or outcomes', '
Team player with ability to collaborate in cross functional teams and build trust based on the work she/he performs', '

Shift:', ' Day', '

Job Description:', '
Role Summary:', '
The Data and Business Intelligence Services is a team under the Data & Analytics organization that is dedicated to providing information management services including Data Architecture and Engineering, Data Enablement, Data Integration, CoE capabilities in Cloud solutions, Big Data and Data Science, and enabling analytics reporting and visualization capabilities across the enterprise.', '
The ', 'Big Data Operations Specialist', ' will be in a technical position in the Big Data CoE which is part of DBIS (Data and Business Intelligence Services) team. You will be joining a hardworking and dedicated team who is working with leading-edge technologies to provide the data/analytics environment to our business.
', 'This role will report to the ', 'Manager, Big Data CoE Operations', '.', '
What will you do:', '
Maintain and support end-to-end Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions', '
Ensure appropriate prioritization and resolution of production defects in accordance with agreed upon SLAs', '
Perform troubleshooting and performance optimization', '
Contribute to definition and implementation of standards and best practices for data warehouse and business intelligence solutions', '
Identify trends and develop appropriate processes to ensure timely resolution and ongoing continuous improvement of key processes', '
Ensure that production/support requirements are met prior to project transition to production', '
Ensure compliance with incident, problem and change management policies and processes', '
Mentoring of junior DW & BI team members', '
Creation and maintenance of documentation', '
Develop an understanding of the business applications supported as well as the business directions', '
Monitor operational process continuously and engage leadership as required', '
What you need to succeed?', '
5+ years of experience working in a DW/BI environment', '
5+ years of experience with ETL Tools: Informatica PowerCenter, BDE, SQL script, stored procedures', '
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and strong knowledge of SQL', '
A minimum of 2-5 year of experience in a support role for Data warehouse', '
Building process and frameworks for COE for user on-boarding, data on-boarding, service catalog, data catalog, change management etc.', '
Experience in providing user support and communication', '
Experience using Hive and SQL', '
Experience ingesting external data to Hadoop environments', '
Experience working with very large data sets, including knowledge of how to build programs that leverage the parallel capabilities of Hadoop', '
Experience working in an Linux/Unix setting and willingness to continue learning new technologies', '
Demonstrate leadership quality, strong communication, organizational skills, a positive attitude, and the proven ability to negotiate and influence others to obtain desired results', '
What’s in it for you:', '
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data', '
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security', '
A common sense dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day', '
An environment of continuous learning and improvement', '
The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential', '

['Through our core values, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.
', '
Benefits to joining Allstate
', '
Complete Group Benefits Program customizable to your needs
', '
Strong Brand Recognition (listed as best Employer with Kincentric since 2012).
', '
Working within the community and giving back!
', '
Opportunity for career development and growth.
', '
We work a 37.5 hour work week and we are proud to offer work from home opportunities once you have demonstrated knowledge and the required skills.
', '
Allstate Insurance Canada Group is looking for exceptional data scientist to synthesize our extensive policyholder and claims data into business enhancing predictive models that will ultimately impact the company’s bottom line. This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team who work on high-impact projects to bring efficiencies to all functional areas of our business. The team works in a fast-paced environment, using techniques and algorithms best suited for solving challenging problems of the insurance industry.
', '
The successful candidate will gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resources and marketing, working on high impact actionable projects. You will learn the business knowledge of the prospective stakeholder through their information datasets. Combining quantitative data with business domain knowledge, you will transform them into predictive models that provide insights that ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables. This role will work hand in hand with data scientists, business stakeholders in developing models and identifying strategies to improve the company’s bottom line.
', '
', 'Qualifications & Experience:', '
Minimum of 2 - 3 years of Machine Learning and analytics experience within a professional services firm or similar industrial environment.
', '
Solid experience in implementing data transformations and text matching algorithms using Python.
', "
Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college in a Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or a related field .
", '
Working experience in Machine learning algorithms, model implementation and optimization to solve Regression, Classification and Segmentation problems.
', '
Basic usage of SAS and SQL, knowledge of, Java or VBA would be an asset.
', '
Experience with ML frameworks/libraries e.g. Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tensor flow or Pytorch would be an asset.
', '
Business and analytics acumen to run and interpret the results of models - turn large amounts of complex, detailed information into clear summaries and business recommendations.
', '
Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to work in a team environment and across multiple sites and business units.
', '
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills - be able to effectively communicate complex results to a business audience not familiar with complex data and analytics.
', '
', 'Nice to have:', '
Experience working with NLP or NLU related problems, topic modelling, and event discovery and sentiment analysis.
', '
Functional knowledge of working with open source using Python, Git and Hadoop stack.
', '
Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
', '
Allstate Insurance Company of Canada is one of the country's leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving Canadians since 1953. The company strives to keep its customers in "Good Hands®" as well as its employees, and is proud to be named a Best Employer in Canada. Allstate Canada is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as MADD Canada, United Way and Junior Achievement. To learn more about Allstate Canada, visit www.allstate.ca . For safety tips and advice, visit www.goodhandsadvice.ca .
', '
For the eighth consecutive year, we are proud to be recognized as a #Kincentric Best Employer!']
