', '
Unit Summary', '
', '
Our mission is simple: create value through insight. Our vision is to become sector leaders in analytics by developing best-in-class people, processes and tools that enable advanced analytics across our enterprise. The Data, Analytics & Planning stream of the Digital Health Plan is a multi-year program geared at investing in our data and analytics infrastructure and the people and processes who will leverage it. The Manager, Analytics & Business solutions will play an integral role supporting major milestones of the Digital Health Plan that include an advanced data repository, implementation of an enterprise-wide business intelligence solution and leading a product road map for reporting and advanced analytics to predict and optimize patient volume, mix and hospital resource allocation.', '
', '
Position Summary', '
', '
Reporting to the Director, Planning & Analysis and BI, the Manager, Analytics and Business Solutions will be responsible for delivering a user-centric suite of reporting and analytics solutions for the enterprise. The Manager will lead team of approximately 10 professionals stratifying 3 three streams of work:', '
', 'Business analysis and stakeholder needs assessments', 'Product strategy: develop and management of self-service dashboard and reporting solution', 'Advanced analytics: statistical/AI/ML modeling for enterprise resource planning', '
The ideal candidate will bring passion, curiosity and most of all, know-how in establishing an advanced analytics program in a large organization. The successful candidate is a proven leader with strong technical knowledge in the analytics and data science space with a background in math & statistics or computer/software engineering. The successful candidate must have an ability to counter-balance their technical expertise with a customer-first mindset and a pragmatic leadership approach. This role will require a high-degree of stakeholder engagement, team leadership and an ability to support significant change as new products are implemented and rolled out across the organization. Prior healthcare experience is an asset but not mandatory.
', 'The Manager will be expected to partner with stakeholders across the organization as the team must successfully gather requirements, build a product roadmap and execute the analytics strategy. A key partnership will be required with the enterprise data team who will focus on a building a data repository for integrated, high quality data assets for use in our reporting and analytics solutions. The Manager will also be expected to work closely with the data governance manager in identifying areas of risk and opportunity to improve data quality.
', 'This is an exciting opportunity to lead a generational investment in an analytics and lead a data science evolution that few others have done in the healthcare space in Ontario.', '
', '
', 'Schedule Work Hours', '
', '
Days, Monday to Friday with willingness to be flexible with working hours to suit organizational needs.', '
', '
Qualifications', '
', '
1. Bachelor’s degree in math and stats, computer or software engineering. Masters or advanced business degree (MBA) an asset.
', '
2. Up to 10 years of experience in the space of analytics, data science and business intelligence.
', '
3. At least 3 years of management experience with a proven ability to lead a team of professionals (energize, coach, encourage, motivate, develop)', '
4. Proven experience moving an organization along the analytics maturity curve from basic reporting to advanced analytics (from experimentation to mass production)', '
5. An ability to measure effectiveness and deliver ROI of analytics', '
6. Experience implementing/working through an analytics community of practice (meet-ups, sharing, coding reviews, joint hiring practices, version control, etc.)', '
7. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the proven ability to build relationships, evangelize the analytics program and influence at all levels of the organization', '
8. Experience engaging customers/stakeholders, assessing needs, developing and executing a product strategy roadmap
', '
9. Familiarity with leading business intelligence solutions such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik', '
10. Experience in applying and implementing advanced stats/ML/AI tools incl. R, Python, Scala etc.', '
11. An energetic and continuous improvement mindset with focus on professional development, research and leading practices in the analytics and data science space.
', '
12. A creative, solution-focused problem solver, with the energy and tenacity to work through a complex systems with multiple challenges.', '
13. Ability to work well under pressure, with strong organizational skills that enable the management of multiple and competing priorities.', '
', '
Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.', '
', '
To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.', '
', '
Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Services at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.', '
', '
', "This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment", '
', '
Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset
', '
', '
If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:', '
', 'Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement
', 'Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement
', 'Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement
', 'Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement
', 'Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement']

['Who is Geotab:', '
', '
Geotab, a global leader in connected transportation and IoT, is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in North America and a certified “Great Place to Work.” Each day, Geotab processes billions of data points from over 1.8 million connected vehicles. Geotab extracts actionable insights from this data, empowering businesses to track and manage fleets of every size. Geotab’s hardware devices, software platforms and applications help keep drivers in over 130 countries compliant, safe and efficient. Global demand for telematics is increasing and Geotab is leading the way. Are you ready to join us? To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook today!', '
', '
Who we are looking for:', '
Can you design, develop and maintain a machine learning pipeline? Do you have a background in software development? Are you comfortable working with extremely large data sets? If so, you might be the newest member of our Data & Analytics Team. Geotab is seeking a Software Engineer, Machine Learning, who can help us build production machine learning pipelines. We are looking for candidates with a deep understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning. You’ll also need skills in software development, systems and big data analysis. Our ideal team member will be able to implement, test and maintain scalable data pipelines. Why not apply today?', '
', '
What are the details of this position:', '
As a Software Engineer, Machine Learning, you will take research outcomes, models and analysis from Data Scientists, and put them into production. Geotab’s systems process billions of data points daily and the pipeline you build will be used to make predictions on millions of vehicles. Our Data Scientists have built cutting-edge experimental machine learning models that recommend vehicles for drivers based on driving behaviour, estimate driver safety and predict vehicle battery life; you will put these experimental models into production. The ML model accounts for 5% of the code of a production ML pipeline. The rest of the code goes into components that ingest data, transform the data, validate the data, orchestrate the jobs, verify predictions and into other components related to evaluation, training and tuning.
', 'Duties and Tasks/Essential Functions:', '
Own design, development and maintenance of scalable production machine learning pipeline that includes data ingestion, data transformation, data validation, automatic model training, automatic model tuning, model evaluation, orchestration, model management and other components', '
Use TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Kubeflow, Airflow, Apache Beam, Big Query and other Big Data and Cloud based technologies to implement and scale machine learning models', '
Interact with Geotab’s BigData Infrastructure on Google Bigquery using Python and SQL', '
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for prediction and model building', '
Select features and build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques; create feature marts to store features', '
Use machine learning packages like scikit-learn and Tensorflow to develop ML models, features for ML models and visualize features; build and maintain software to manage the models', '
Interface with Product Managers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Software Developers to gather requirements', '
Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve Geotab product suite', '
Support a platform providing ad-hoc and automated access to large datasets, models and predictions', '
', 'Experience/Skills Required:', '
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, Statistics, Math or related', '
3+ years’ applied machine learning experience working with extremely large datasets to solve real-world problems', '
3+ years’ experience in deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow 2.0 and PyTorch) and ML libraries (Keras, NumPy, Pandas and scikit-learn) and computing frameworks such as Spark', '
Demonstrated knowledge of relevant libraries and operating systems (OpenCV, Linux)', '
Familiarity with SQL and No-SQL databases', '
Familiarity with MapReduce, Apache Beam, Spark and other similar frameworks and using them to build scalable data pipelines', '
Experience with Google Cloud, Google Bigquery and containerization systems such as Kubernetes and Docker', '
Strong understanding of probability theory and data modeling', '

Excellent communication skills with ability to work with multidisciplinary teams

Our Core Values:', '
', '
Geotab is shaping the future of telematics. Using leading technology, we embrace change and challenge the status quo. JOB TITLE: ['Director, Name Screening, AML/ATF Models and Analytics']
JOB DECSRIPTION:
['Requisition ID: 63443', '
', '
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.', '
', 'Purpose', ':', '
The Director, Name Screening, AML/ATF Models and Analytics is responsible for leading a team that applies sophisticated statistical techniques to enhance the name and payment screening processes for Scotiabank across all products across all countries. The Director will apply statistical, data mining and pattern analysis techniques to create new rules/logic for name screening and / or tuning of the rules in line with Scotiabank’s risk appetite and policies.', '
', 'Accountabilities:', '
Lead the application of sophisticated statistical techniques to develop and enhance name screening and payment screening rules/logic for a wide range of products across all countries in Scotiabank’s global footprint
', 'Understanding latest advances in AML analytics & predictive models, including applications Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning', '
Provide direction to the model development teams to scope, understand and appropriately document the models. Develop and update statistical approaches with longer term strategies to mitigate this risk and improve the model performance across products and services globally
', 'Oversee the team in ensuring all procedures and practices are complied with regulatory and internal requirements', '
Lead a team of quantitative risk professionals in this area', '
End to end ownership of Name Screening analytics, including rule/logic development, tuning, documentation, deployment (in collaboration with IT&S) and monitoring
', 'Frequently interface with regulators, auditors and model validation teams.', '
', 'Requirements & Experience:', '
Statistical modeling and data science methods', '
Programming in statistical languages such as R, SAS. Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server', '
AML/ATF experience or analytic knowledge', '
Name scanning applications such as HotScan, FircoSoft and Bridger is a must', '
People manager for minimum 3 years', '
Master’s degree or higher in science, technology, engineering or mathematics preferred', '
', 'Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto', "
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted."]

['Next Pathway', ' - The Automated Cloud Migration Company', 'Listed as one of Canada’s hottest start-ups by the Globe and Mail, Next Pathway is a technology services company providing clients a pathway from existing to emerging technologies. ['This company is an e-retailer with a unique method for collecting books. It combined this strategy with the development of simple software that only analyzes current market information. This has created efficiencies in the pricing and processing of books. We are looking to build off of this initial software by starting Price Point. Its goal is to create predictive pricing models using historical data and machine learning. Additionally, once the item is “live” there is a need to keep the listing competitive in a dynamic marketplace. We hope to apply this new technology to our current operations and to initially market it as a pricing engine for third-party sellers on Amazon.
', '
', 'Title:', ' Data Scientist
', 'Salary:', ' 90-150k
', 'Location:', ' Remote work (must be eligible to work in Canada)
', '
We are looking for individuals who have a background in quantitative analysis/data analytics and possess a range of skills including data structuring and machine learning.
', '
', 'Research:', '
', '
', 'Discover solutions to unique data science challenges while satisfying business needs', '
', '
', 'Develop and Implement:', '
', '
', 'Build the full solution:', '
', 'Loading and cleaning the data', '
', 'Preparing and training the model', '
', 'Deploying, monitoring and maintaining the solution', '
', '
']

Job Description:', '
Role Summary:', '
The Data and Business Intelligence Services is a team under the Data & Analytics organization that is dedicated to providing information management services including Data Architecture and Engineering, Data Enablement, Data Integration, CoE capabilities in Cloud solutions, Big Data and Data Science, and enabling analytics reporting and visualization capabilities across the enterprise.', '
The ', 'Big Data Operations Specialist', ' will be in a technical position in the Big Data CoE which is part of DBIS (Data and Business Intelligence Services) team. You will be joining a hardworking and dedicated team who is working with leading-edge technologies to provide the data/analytics environment to our business.
', 'This role will report to the ', 'Manager, Big Data CoE Operations', '.', '
What will you do:', '
Maintain and support end-to-end Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions', '
Ensure appropriate prioritization and resolution of production defects in accordance with agreed upon SLAs', '
Perform troubleshooting and performance optimization', '
Contribute to definition and implementation of standards and best practices for data warehouse and business intelligence solutions', '
Identify trends and develop appropriate processes to ensure timely resolution and ongoing continuous improvement of key processes', '
Ensure that production/support requirements are met prior to project transition to production', '

Creation and maintenance of documentation', '
Develop an understanding of the business applications supported as well as the business directions', '

5+ years of experience working in a DW/BI environment', '

Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and strong knowledge of SQL', '
A minimum of 2-5 year of experience in a support role for Data warehouse', '
Building process and frameworks for COE for user on-boarding, data on-boarding, service catalog, data catalog, change management etc.', '
Experience in providing user support and communication', '
Experience using Hive and SQL', '
Experience ingesting external data to Hadoop environments', '
Experience working with very large data sets, including knowledge of how to build programs that leverage the parallel capabilities of Hadoop', '
Experience working in an Linux/Unix setting and willingness to continue learning new technologies', '
Demonstrate leadership quality, strong communication, organizational skills, a positive attitude, and the proven ability to negotiate and influence others to obtain desired results', '

Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data', '
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security', '
A common sense dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day', '
An environment of continuous learning and improvement', '
The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential', '

', 'Thank you for your interest in BMO Financial Group. We are currently working towards providing a better candidate experience by including all of our job descriptions in both English and French. In the meantime, if this role is located in Quebec and/or New Brunswick please reference the French job description available below the English version. Otherwise please see the job description below in English as per federal language requirements.', '
', "
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt à l'égard de BMO Groupe financier. Nous travaillons actuellement à offrir une meilleure expérience aux candidats en publiant toutes nos descriptions de poste en français et en anglais. Entre-temps, si ce poste est affiché au Québec ou au Nouveau-Brunswick, veuillez consulter la description de poste en français disponible sous la version anglaise. Autrement, veuillez consulter la description de poste ci-dessous en anglais, conformément aux exigences fédérales en matière de langues.
", 'Summary:
', '
Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (ML and AI) is a strategic initiative in risk management. The candidate will participate in new projects and be hands-on along side internal experts. The candidate will have a concrete and meaningful contribution to the final deliverables and is expect to show autonomy and ownership of their deliverables.
', '
', '
The candidate will be responsible for identifying AI and ML use cases in the Risk Capital and Model Development group and building these models in partnership with the existing team. This will cover multiple areas such as Anti-Money Laundering, Credit Risk, Economic Capital etc.
', '
', '
The candidate will also be working on identifying automation opportunities where existing processes can be enhanced and simplified using AI.
', '
', '
The role also has a technology component where the candidate will participate in the assessment of the current risk technology stack and test and validate assumptions on new tools.
', '
', '
', 'Description:
', '
', 'Use case identification:
', 'Expand on the currently identified use cases by partnering with the existing model development groups and the business partners and identify other types of models/applications where ML and AI can add value. This will cover areas such as credit risk, economic capital, AML and market risk.
', '
Structure above identified use cases, define operating model, manage delivery and provide
', '
', 'Data collection and manipulation
', 'Collect data for model development purposes by identifying new candidate variables and predictive variables.
', '
Analyze and summarize data to identify outliers and assess data quality.
', '
Perform data imputation using advanced statistical techniques (multiple imputation, machine learning estimations).
', '
Transform and prepare the data for developing AI models.
', '
', 'Predictive models development
', 'Fully understand the existing version of the models where applicable, their limitations and all the underlying assumptions made.
', '
Use the prepared data to build machine learning predictive models using advanced regression techniques such as random forests, neural networks, boosted trees, deep learning, logistic regressions, NLP etc
', '
Rank and compare the candidate models to select the best fitting models.
', '
Use statistical tests to ensure the stability and robustness of the candidate models.
', '
Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning in the current model development process.
', '
', 'Reasonableness assessment
', 'Ensure that the models developed make business and intuitive sense by participating in sessions with the model owners, lines of businesses and including their feedback in the model.
', '
Design a process to explain the output of the models on a consistent basis to understand why the models are producing these decisions.
', '
', 'Documentation
', 'Document the process along the way by capturing the details around all assumptions made.
', '
Keep record and detailed notes about the thought process. The models developed will serve as a proof of concept for future ML & AI models in credit risk.', '
', '
Skills required:
', '
Master or PhD candidate in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related quantitative field.
', '
5-10 years of experience in AML, risk management and machine learning and AI techniques
', '
Familiarity with risk management processes and methodologies, ideally AML
', '
Familiarity with Bank credit instruments and product structures
', '
Familiarity with systems management and data architecture principles
', '
Experience with statistical model development and data mining
', '
Proven experience using SAS, R or Python to build machine learning models
', '
Strong theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques and advanced regression methods and data imputation techniques
', '
Well-developed relationship management skills.
', '
Excellent influencing and negotiation skills
', '
Strong problem solving skills and capacity to turnaround analysis in short period of time
', '
Comfortable in a challenging environment with tight timelines
', '
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
', '
Capacity to cope with a high degree of ambiguity and change
', '
Ability to work both independently and as part of cross-functional teams
', '
Prior industry experience or academic projects with machine learning and advanced programming is preferred.
', '
High-level of competency with MS Office suite of tools
', 'We’re here to help
', '
', '
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
', '
', '
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
', '
', '
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
', '
', '
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.']

JOB TITLE: ['Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Computer Vision, Deep Learning and SLAM']
JOB DECSRIPTION: ['Position Description', 'Area: ', ' Computer Vision and Deep Learning', 'Duration: ', ' 2 years', 'Starting Date: ', ' April 1st, 2020', 'Salary: ', ' $60,000 - $80,000 plus York University’s standard benefit package', 'Dr. Gunho Sohn’s Lab (www.yorku.ca/~gsohn) in the Department of Earth and Space Science and Engineering at York University in Toronto is opening Multiple Postdoctoral Fellowships to work on the development of deep learning methods for computer vision and SLAM. The successful candidates will work on an exciting project to develop an innovative pipeline for 3D semantic mapping and SLAM using mobile laser point clouds and images. This is a collaborative project with Teledyne Optec in Toronto (https://www.teledyneoptech.com/en/home/), the world leader in the development and manufacture of advanced fully-integrated lidar and camera solutions in ground-based, airborne and spaceborne mapping systems.', 'Research Areas: ', ' The application of deep learning to automatic generation of 3D semantic maps using the sheer amount of mobile mapping data is a rapidly growing area of research and the successful applicant will be expected to develop novel techniques to address the unique challenges posed by image understanding and mapping in complex urban environments.', 'Applicants for Postdoctoral Fellowship will have demonstrated expertise in computer vision and machine learning, with particular experience and educational background in one or more of the following areas: ', 'Deep Learning;', 'Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM); and', '3D Computer Vision;', 'Required Qualifications', 'Doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years.', 'Proven publication record in computer vision, machine learning and photogrammetry research.', 'Programming experience in Python and/or C++.', 'Experience with one or more of TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.', 'Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral.', 'The candidate should have a doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years and demonstrate proven publication record in computer vision and machine learning research. ', 'The position is for two years. The salary for this position is competitive and the starting date is April 1st, 2020.', 'Research Environment: ', ' Dr. Sohn’s lab is located in Lassonde School of Engineering at York University (https://lassonde.yorku.ca/) and Centre for Research in Earth and Space Science (CRESS) (http://cress.info.yorku.ca/). Research interests include the development of 3D primitive based urban modelling and augmentation, autonomous mapping and navigation and digital infrastructure modelling. The postdoctoral fellow will be working with faculty and graduate students in several research programs led by York University:', 'NSERC CREATE Data Analytics & Visualization (https://www.createdav.com/welcome/)', 'Intelligent Systems for Sustainable Urban Mobility (http://issum.yorku.ca/)', 'Advanced Disaster, Emergency and Rapid Response Simulation (http://adersim.info.yorku.ca/)', 'Vision: Science to Application (http://vista.info.yorku.ca/).', 'To Apply: ', 'Please submit a brief statement of research interests, a curriculum vitae and a list of publications and contact information for 2-3 references (not letters required at this stage).', 'Information ', 'about Dr. Sohn’s lab at York University can be found at www.yorku.ca/~gsohn. Following Canadian Employment and Immigration guidelines, applicants must be eligible to', 'work in Canada.', 'Reference ID: Postdoc Fellowship in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, SLAM', 'Contract length: 24 months', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Experience:', 'Deep Learning: 2 years (Preferred)']

['Join our team of Engineers where you’ll bring your expertise in Natural Language Processing and apply it to our suite of CPM solutions. You will work with experts, implementing Domain Specific Languages to enable business users to interact with Prophix, without any technical expertise, in the overall use of the underlying technology.
', 'Reporting to the VP of Research & Development, you’ll play a critical role in defining the architecture and technical implementation around the non-UI driven interactions that users will have with our product. You’ll work to define the grammars, tools and technics used to bring natural language to our products
', 'Responsibilities:', '
', 'Working with Architects, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to develop and support the software for new language interfaces.', '

', 'Explore and research new methods pertaining to future product development.', '
', 'Be a key component in creating a product that is ensured to be the future of our marketplace.', '

', '5+ years developing both internal and external domain specific languages', '
', '3+ years working with speech to text, and text to speech solutions', '
', 'A proven track record of integrating chatbot solutions into business applications', '
', 'Exposure to a wide variety of NLP solutions including AWS Lex, IBM Watson, Microsoft Cortana, Apple Siri, etc', '
', 'Expertise in the theory, design and implementation of compilers, interpreters and processors for both internal and external domain specific languages', '
', 'Expertise in one or more of the following Lexer/Parser generators: Lex/Yacc, Flex/Bison, Antlr', '
', 'Able to demonstrate a thorough knowledge of language grammar design in BNF', '
', 'What People Say About Prophix', '
', '

Prophix’s Management has got it right.” – ', 'Tim McCarthy, Finance Manager, Feeding America – A Prophix Customer since 2009', '

But, one of the things that makes Prophix unique is that we are always doing something to further enrich the lives of our team. That’s the only way to attract and keep great people." – ', 'Paul Barber, CEO of Prophix', '
', '
COMPANY BENEFITS AND PERKS', '
', 'Competitive Compensation:', '
', 'Excellent Base Salary', '
', 'Lucrative Bonus Program', '
', 'Candidate Referral Bonus Program', '
', 'Rewards and Recognition programs including Presidents Club (trip) and numerous departmental awards', '
', 'Comprehensive Benefits:', '
', 'Wide-ranging Health Benefits including: Vision care, EAP, short and long term disability (Canada & USA). Benefits may vary by country.', '
', 'Company matched RRSP, 401(k), or UK Pension', '
', 'Company-paid fitness club/gym membership', '
', 'Training reimbursement and internal training programs to enhance learning opportunities for employees', '
', 'Company cell phone or cell reimbursement for designated roles', '
', 'Employee Participation:', '
', 'Corporate Social Responsibility Committee', '
', 'Prophix-sponsored sports teams', '
', 'Semi-Annual Town Hall meetings', '
', 'Social Committee events', '
', 'Departmental and Company Social Events', '
', 'WORKING CONDITIONS', '
', '
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time for meetings or work, travel to different locations via plane within Canada and the United States, operate a motor vehicle (with a valid driver’s license), operate a personal computer, visually inspect forms, conduct oral communication via telephone and in person, retrieve and return files in storage cabinets, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. ', 'Our Canadian Actuarial, Rewards and Analytics (ARA) team is part of Deloitte’s worldwide actuarial network, which includes over 1000 actuarial professionals working in 43 countries. ARA is part of Deloitte’s Assurance & Advisory practice and provides a wide range of services.

', 'Why Deloitte?', '
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is ', 'The One Firm', ' for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:', '
You will lead at every level:', ' We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.', '
You can work your way:', ' We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.', '
You will feel included and inspired:', ' We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.', '
', '
The next step is yours', '
Sound like ', 'The One Firm. For You?', '
At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!', '
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.']

['About Assurance', "
At Assurance we are disrupting the antiquated and inefficient world of insurance and financial services. Our team of world class software engineers, data scientists, and business professionals are modernizing how people obtain and manage their financial life all through our powerful platform ecosystem. We are rapidly growing as we expand our product offerings and global footprint, and this growth continues to present new and exciting challenges as we push our industry into its future. We eliminate waste throughout the industry and calculate the complex into simple, valuable solutions to improve people's lives. We are humble, driven, and committed to improving the lives of millions.", '
', '
About the Position', '
As we build the future of consumer insurance in a modern age, data and machine learning are at the core of everything that we do. The role requires team members who take insights, actions, and models from our data scientists and translate that into software products that enable business optimization. We currently have more than 40 models in production and are doing about 5 million real-time predictions per day. Our team uses a variety of data mining and analysis methods, uses a variety of data tools, builds and implements models, develops algorithms, and creates simulations. Our ML Engineers design and build the prediction services that makes this development possible with no support from engineering (we own our stack end to end). At Assurance, we hire experts in their field, and we give them the independence and trust to build based on their expertise.', '
', '
We’re changing the world of consumer insurance and financial services everyday through the power of Machine Learning and Data Science – join us on the journey!', '
', 'To be successful in this role, you must possess the following:', '
A drive to move fast and deliver business value.', '
4+ years of backend software engineering in a team environment.', '
Experience writing and debugging complex database queries and code.', '
Ability to quickly learn new technologies to help the team explore new solutions.', '
Excellent communication ability – you can explain your work in a way that anyone on the team can understand, and you can frame problems in a way that ensures the right question is being asked.', '
Business Acumen – you are always eager to understand how the business works, and more specifically, how your work impacts the business.', '
Mentorship of others – you raise the bar on coding standards and providing meaningful feedback on code changes.', '
Enthusiastic yet humble nature – you are excited about the work you do, but you are also humble enough to embrace feedback – you don’t need to be the smartest person in the room.', '
Bachelors degree in mathematics, statistics, data science or related field of study.', '
', 'The following additional experience is desired:', '
Experience with writing production-level Python.', '
Unit and integration testing.', '
Use of cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure).', '
Participate in agile methodologies (daily standup, sprint planning, retros).', '
Profiling and performance tuning of production code a bonus.', '
Direct experience with using ML libraries like sklearn, or Spark ML in a production environment a huge bonus!']

['About the company:', '
', '
AltaML is a fast-growing startup that focuses on applied ML. We partner with industry to co-develop AI/ML powered products. We are experts in ML commercialization and help our industrial partners gain a competitive advantage by combining their data and domain expertise with our analytics and ML proficiency. Data informs our every move, and we aim to work quickly, collaboratively and creatively. We have offices in Edmonton and Calgary and our now looking to staff our newly formed Toronto office. This is your chance to be part of our new and growing Toronto presence!', '
', '
Who we are looking for:', '
', '
Our core values speak volumes about who we are and how we work:', '
', '
Humble', ' – Listen to the data', '
', 'Happy', ' – Tap-dance to work', '
', 'Gritty', ' – Be persistent, not complacent', '
', 'Agile', ' – Make small bets, then iterate', '
', '
Our current and future employees:', '
', '
', 'express our core values', '
', 'are hungry for knowledge', '
', 'want to learn new skills', '
', 'are respectful', '
', 'collaborate with others across the whole company', '
', 'share knowledge with coworkers', '
', 'educate and promote AI and ML concepts both internally and externally', '
', 'have a high work ethic and are self-motivated', '
', '
', 'What we have to offer you:', '
', '
You will be able to experience a silicon valley like company culture. Your work will be applied and will have a high impact on our clients in Alberta and now in Toronto. You will have the opportunity to impact the economies in both provinces! We work with multiple industries so you will gain experience and domain expertise working on data that comes from different fields. You will be working with people with multiple years of industrial and academic experience in data science, software engineering, and machine learning fields. To solve the problems we apply various ML techniques from traditional Machine Learning and Data Mining algorithms, through to vision, Deep Learning, Information Extraction, advanced NLP and conversational agents.', '
', '
We also have fun. We believe in working hard, getting the job done and enjoying a beer on Fridays. You’ll also get flexibility in where you work, what hours you work, how much vacation you take, and what you wear. We expect hard work but respect work/life balance.', '
', '
Job role:', '
', '
As Senior Machine Learning Developer and a member of Data Science team you play a crucial role in making sure we advance ML projects and deliver value to customers. Your primary responsibility is to solve problems utilizing Data Mining and Machine Learning techniques and to provide your ML/technical expertise to the rest of the team. You will work with multiple tools and gain experience in multiple AI/ML and data processing fields. You will be given resources and mentorship to help with your growth and career advancement.', '
', '
Responsibilities:', '
', '
', 'Participate in team planning sessions', '
', 'Participate in infrequent technical meetings with customers', '
', 'Complete well defined and exploratory tasks under minimal supervision', '
', 'Help with defining a problem that needs to be solved', '
', 'Suggest and explore novel solutions to a problem', '
', 'Provide mentorship to our Data Science team', '
', 'Shape the Data Science architecture and make technical decisions', '
', 'Evaluate the meaningfulness of specific methods and techniques for a given AI/ML problem', '
', 'Responsible for maintaining codebase, seeking for reusable components, suggesting and implementing changes', '
', '
', 'Minimum Requirements:', '
', '
', '5+ years of relevant academic and/or industrial experience in conducting AI/ML projects', '
', 'Degree in Comp Sci, Comp Eng, Statistics, or related field', '
', 'Proficiency with software development', '
', 'Expertise with Python (Pandas, SciKit, and similar) and Unix operating systems', '
', 'Expertise with Machine Learning and Data Mining concepts and techniques', '
', '
', ' Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. We’ll let you in on a secret - there is no such thing as a perfect candidate. AltaML is working with new technologies, and no one is standing still when it comes to learning. As long as you are continuing to push your growth and development, then consider applying even if you don’t check all the boxes on our posting. So, however you identify and whatever background and experiences you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you “tap dance to work” every day. We would love to add your biological uniqueness to our own! :-)']

['Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most meaningfully to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!', '
Role:', '
Do you have a passion for building software that leverages the power of machine learning? Do you want to be part of the founding team for a new mobile first product and build something from the ground up?', "
Splunk's Toronto Engineering team is looking for a machine learning software engineer to build an innovative solution that leverages machine learning at the edge. You will get to work with dedicated individuals who are doing state of the art development (backend, frontend and embedded machine learning) in the areas of machine learning, deep learning and data analytics to build best-in-class business analytics software. You will be interacting with product management and customers to understand detailed requirements. You will also work with other engineering teams across Splunk to design and build high-performance solutions.", '
Requirements:', '
8+ years of meaningful industry experience', '
Proven industry experience building software with machine learning', '
You have experience with Tensorflow or Pytorch', '
Experience writing software in Python and Java', '
Experience with embedded systems, Google Coral or Raspberry Pi is an asset', '
Proven experience in leading critical, architectural decisions for a development team, providing sound technical direction and communicating effectively', '
Experience in working with Restful APIs', '
Experience collaborating with design and cross functional engineering teams to make the complex simple for the user', '
Full stack development experience on large, high throughput systems', '
Comfortable working with development on Linux, Unix, and MacOS systems', '
BS CS/EE or equivalent', '
You have built applications on AWS or equivalent services', '
You have excellent problem solving skills and great attention to details', '
You have strong communication/interpersonal skills, both verbal and written', '
You have an ability to learn new technologies quickly and understand a wide variety of technical challenges to be solved', '
Nice to have', '
You are familiar with writing code that works across all popular platforms and browsers', '
You have experience in building services that support native mobile (Android or iOS) apps', '
You are skilled at using CSS & HTML to produce interfaces from design mock-ups', '
You are proficient with GIT', '
What We Offer You:', "
A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.", '
A set of exceptionally collaborative and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.', '
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.', '
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.', '
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.', '
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records']

['Miovision’s mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrow’s smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the world’s most advanced traffic AI, Miovision’s innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit
', 'www.miovision.com
', '
[http://www.miovision.com/]
', 'Position Summary
', '
You will own and maintain product execution, including creating definition of features, user stories, and acceptance criteria to maximize the experience and value of Miovision’s
', 'TrafficLink Analytics [https://miovision.com/trafficlink/traffic-insights/] product offering.
', '
You provide direction with clear requirements to the Analytics development team to help deliver highly usable and impactful features and experiences to Miovision’s customers. You are execution driven, and metrics informed to ensure quality, on-time results for critical business and customer goals.
', '
Key Accountabilities
', '
', 'Work closely with the Product Manager, Analytics to define and prioritize product roadmaps', '
', 'Flush out market and customer requirements with UX and Analytics development team to determine features, user stories, acceptance criteria accordingly.', '
', 'Collaborate with Analytics, Data Science, and other development teams to determine and account for interdependencies.', '
', 'Manage and administer quarterly/sprint goals, forward-looking roadmaps, sprint meetings and time tracking.', '
', 'Prioritize between long term goals and short term market/customer/ company needs.', '
', 'Collaborate with Product Managers to set success/exit criteria for product plans and validate that criteria', '
', 'Collaborate with a cross-functional team of designers, developers, UX/UI, testers, sales, marketing, and others to develop and execute against product roadmaps and release plans', '
', 'Understand the technical decisions/benefits/tradeoffs, and provide guidance to the Analytics development team to ensure broadest product benefits', '
', 'Promote Agile development methodology throughout the work and teams', '
', 'Ensure that engineering deliverables meet agreed-upon standards for quality, brand, UX/UI, and requirements, and that the products or features meet the shared business need', '
', 'Review developed features/functionality to ensure specified acceptance criteria has been met', '
', '
Skills/Qualifications
', '
', '4+ years of experience performing Product & Program Management related responsibilities in a high-tech environment', '
', 'Demonstrated experience in delivering customer value through analytics-centric software applications and tools', '
', 'Experience in working with Agile/Scrum work environment as a Product Owner: writing user stories and following the development process through user story acceptance', '
', 'Comfortable driving teams and management to decisions; willing to push-back for information and answers', '
', '
Perks and Benefits
', '
', 'Comprehensive health benefits', '
', 'Enhanced paternity and maternity leaves', '
', 'Unlimited vacation policy', '
', 'Wellness Perks - on-site gym and fitness classes, massage therapy and chiropractic care', '
', 'Free Parking', '
', 'Office snacks and drinks', '
', 'A games room including ping pong, foosball and pinball machines', '
', 'Family friendly events (golf tournament, summer picnic, Children’s Christmas party)', '
', '
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.']

JOB TITLE: ['Manager, Data Engineering - Machine Learning, Global Risk Management']
JOB DECSRIPTION:
['Requisition ID: 82275', '
', '
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.', '
', '
Manager, Data Engineering - Machine Learning', '
', 'As the ', 'Manager, Data Engineering, ', 'you will deliver and maintain large-scale data infrastructure projects to support the creation and implementation of bank customer risk models', '
', 'What will you do in this role?', '
Co-design and implement data mart to ensure the timely, accurate execution of retail customer models', '
Co-design and implement solutions to maximize speed of development for retail customer models', '
Validate large data sets for completeness, accuracy, consistency and timeliness', '
Document data solutions. This includes but is not limited to: data dictionaries, data flow diagrams, PowerPoint presentations
', 'What we’re looking for?', '
Undergraduate or higher level degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or other STEM discipline', '
Demonstrated experience implementing data solutions with big-data technologies with Spark is required', '
Demonstrated experience with programming with Python at a proficient level is required', '
Demonstrated experience working with enterprise-level data', '
Working knowledge of Linux and cloud architecture', '
Ability to work tight deadlines and contribute to evolving designs to suit client requirements', '
Ability to work independently or as part of a small team, as required', '
Experience working with Python API frameworks like Flask is an asset', '
External certification related to data development, data science or data engineering is an asset', '
Experience working with Jira, Confluence and Bitbucket is an asset', '
', 'What’s in it for you?', '
The opportunity to gain real-world experience in implementing large projects related to data engineering, machine learning and real-time API’s', '
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers', '
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing a multiple of exciting and forward thinking initiatives from the ground up!', '
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development', '
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills', '
A competitive compensation and benefits package', '
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers', '
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!', '
', 'This position is located on King St W, Toronto', '
', 'Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto', "
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.", '
', '
At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.']

['Senior Software Developer - Machine Learning-2000067P', '
', '
', '
Preferred Qualifications', '
', '
We are currently seeking a Senior Software Developer to join our new Intelligent Suite team in Kitchener-Waterloo.', '
', '
About Oracle NetSuite', '
', 'At NetSuite our goal is to transform how businesses operate. We help businesses achieve their vision, no matter the size or industry. We’re the #1 cloud business software, supporting more than 40,000 organizations, in more than 100 countries. Find out more about Oracle NetSuite at ', 'www.netsuite.com', '.', '
', '
About the Role:', '
', 'This role will be a core member of our Intelligent Suite team. Working inside NetSuite to help teams design and fulfill the vision of bringing Intelligent features to our customers. This role will work closely with our Data Scientist and Infrastructure teams to become an expert in making the data science algorithms come to life in a production environment.', '
', '
You will get to work with smart people that are both geographically and culturally diverse. You get to be on the cutting edge of technology, working with some of the newest Machine Learning (ML) infrastructure, while getting to have an impact on direction and solution design.', '
', '
', 'Responsibilities:', '
', 'Designing, developing, and maintaining the ML implementations and support systems behind Intelligence features', '
', 'Working to uphold best practices for code, APIs, and frameworks', '
', 'Proposing appropriate tools (languages/libraries/frameworks) for implementing projects', '
', 'Keeping up with best practices and being a continual learner', '
', 'Working with local and remote teams to accomplish their intelligent feature goals', '
', 'Working side-by-side with cross-functional teams in their agile environment', '
', 'Identifying opportunities to improve and enhance our customers experience with our software', '
', 'Following deployment and QA processes and best practices', '
', 'Practicing agile, clean software development', '
', '
', 'You will fit perfectly if you have the following:', '
', 'Strong software architecture understanding', '
', 'Desire to delight the customer by taking initiative, responsibility, and ownership of projects', '
', 'Strong focus on quality software engineering', '
', 'Enjoys learning new projects and codebases', '
', 'Strong understanding of distributed architectures is a bonus', '
', 'Ability to have fun!', '
', '
', 'The person we hire will enjoy:', '
', 'Healthy breakfast options every morning.', '
', 'Opportunities for subsidized career and skills growth.', '
', 'Access to a virtual library of training material (O’Reilly Learning, Lynda.com, Oracle Learning, …)', '
', 'Oracle equity in the form of stock options and RSUs.', '
', 'RRSP contribution matching up to 6% of annual salary.', '
', 'Working in an Agile environment.', '
', 'Board games, card games, video games, and donuts.', '
', '
', 'Preferred Qualifications:', '
', 'Computer science or engineering degree (bachelor or above) or equivalent experience', '
', 'Demonstrated recent experience with Machine Learning', '
', '5+ years software development experience', '
', 'Experience with Java, Python, C++, Web technologies', '
', 'Intimate and working understanding of modern API applications from database to endpoints', '
', 'Proficient communicator in both technical and non-technical contexts', '
', 'Skills to debug and understand large Java and SQL code base', '
', 'Strength and comfort in Unix systems', '
', 'Detailed Description and Job Requirements', '
', '
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.', '
', '
As a member of the software engineering division, you will assist in defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, debugging or designing of software applications or operating systems. Provide technical leadership to other software developers. Specify, design and implement modest changes to existing software architecture to meet changing needs.', '
', '
Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.']

['Toronto, CANADA - MULTIPLE ROLES', '
Do you want to help change the way people understand, design for and solve the most challenging real-world design problems in their fields using a combination of Computational Science and Artificial Intelligence? Augmenta is seeking exceptional talent to help us perform research and development on complex multi-industry workflow and design automation challenges.', '
', '
', '
', 'What you get', '
You will get in at the earliest stage, to help design and develop the fundamental architecture for the world’s first creative/generative AI platform. Your work will have a profound impact on complex industry challenges, and the software you write will result in new designs you will see applied in the real world.', '
You will be a part of an exceptional, cross-disciplinary founding team who spearheaded development and adoption of Generative Design technologies, and have delivered cutting-edge work for organizations like NASA, General Motors, Autodesk, Facebook, Royal Bank of Canada and ALDO. You will continually be in contact with and learning from cutting edge researchers and domain experts across industries.', '
', '
What you will do', '
Research, design and implement robust, scalable mathematical models for behavioral modeling, simulation and calibration of industry workflows and processes', '
Investigate state-of-the-art machine learning methods by keeping abreast of bleeding-edge literature, interfacing with academic partners and attending appropriate scientific workshops/conferences', '
Collaborate with multidisciplinary team in multiple locations', '
Mentor junior staff and interns to reach their best potential', '
', '
Required Qualifications', '
M.Sc./Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related disciplines', '
Fluent in C++ and Python', '
Exceptional knowledge of linear algebra and calculus', '
Research, design and performance optimization of complex mathematical models', '
Ability to abstract complex parametric and non-parametric systems into representations amenable to supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods', '
Extensive experience with mathematical modeling/machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Torch, OpenAI API, etc.)', '
Extensive experience of using automated testing and continuous integration frameworks
', 'Extensive exposure to software product development and delivery practices and related tools', '
Expert knowledge of API design, component architectures, principles of service-oriented software', '
Mathematical optimization methods, gradient estimation, Bayesian Optimization', '
Parallel computing methods and frameworks', '
', '
Preferred Qualifications', '
Familiarity with fundamental Modeling & Simulation principles and methods', '
Mathematical optimization methods', '
Numerical methods for solving partial differential equations problems', '
Interactive 3D graphics and data visualization', '
Distributed computing', '
GPU acceleration of numerical algorithms using CUDA/OpenCL', '
Amazon Web Services APIs', '
', '
About us', '
Augmenta is an early stage startup founded by industry veterans and pioneers of novel design methods and technologies, building design automation tools that empower designers, engineers and planners to solve the most complex problems in their fields.', "
Starting with people’s goals & inspiration our systems use AI and computational techniques to explore thousands of possible designs - developing solutions that far outperform what anyone could create on their own. We're changing the way we fundamentally understand and solve problems with AI as our design partner.", '
Our goal is to create a world where the extremely difficult problems that face humankind are regularly solved through a completely new holistic way of thinking about and seeing the world, and a strong combination of artificial intelligence, simulation, strategy, empathy and human centered design.', '
Our vision is to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay and do their best work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, identity, orientation, age or disability.', '
Send a Resume and Cover letter to:', '
careers@augmenta.ai']

JOB TITLE: ['Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Computer Vision, Deep Learning and SLAM']
JOB DECSRIPTION: ['Position Description', 'Area: ', ' Computer Vision and Deep Learning', 'Duration: ', ' 2 years', 'Starting Date: ', ' April 1st, 2020', 'Salary: ', ' $60,000 - $80,000 plus York University’s standard benefit package', 'Dr. Gunho Sohn’s Lab (www.yorku.ca/~gsohn) in the Department of Earth and Space Science and Engineering at York University in Toronto is opening Multiple Postdoctoral Fellowships to work on the development of deep learning methods for computer vision and SLAM. The successful candidates will work on an exciting project to develop an innovative pipeline for 3D semantic mapping and SLAM using mobile laser point clouds and images. This is a collaborative project with Teledyne Optec in Toronto (https://www.teledyneoptech.com/en/home/), the world leader in the development and manufacture of advanced fully-integrated lidar and camera solutions in ground-based, airborne and spaceborne mapping systems.', 'Research Areas: ', ' The application of deep learning to automatic generation of 3D semantic maps using the sheer amount of mobile mapping data is a rapidly growing area of research and the successful applicant will be expected to develop novel techniques to address the unique challenges posed by image understanding and mapping in complex urban environments.', 'Applicants for Postdoctoral Fellowship will have demonstrated expertise in computer vision and machine learning, with particular experience and educational background in one or more of the following areas: ', 'Deep Learning;', 'Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM); and', '3D Computer Vision;', 'Required Qualifications', 'Doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years.', 'Proven publication record in computer vision, machine learning and photogrammetry research.', 'Programming experience in Python and/or C++.', 'Experience with one or more of TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.', 'Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral.', 'The candidate should have a doctorate in a relevant discipline obtained within the last five years and demonstrate proven publication record in computer vision and machine learning research. ', 'The position is for two years. The salary for this position is competitive and the starting date is April 1st, 2020.', 'Research Environment: ', ' Dr. Sohn’s lab is located in Lassonde School of Engineering at York University (https://lassonde.yorku.ca/) and Centre for Research in Earth and Space Science (CRESS) (http://cress.info.yorku.ca/). Research interests include the development of 3D primitive based urban modelling and augmentation, autonomous mapping and navigation and digital infrastructure modelling. The postdoctoral fellow will be working with faculty and graduate students in several research programs led by York University:', 'NSERC CREATE Data Analytics & Visualization (https://www.createdav.com/welcome/)', 'Intelligent Systems for Sustainable Urban Mobility (http://issum.yorku.ca/)', 'Advanced Disaster, Emergency and Rapid Response Simulation (http://adersim.info.yorku.ca/)', 'Vision: Science to Application (http://vista.info.yorku.ca/).', 'To Apply: ', 'Please submit a brief statement of research interests, a curriculum vitae and a list of publications and contact information for 2-3 references (not letters required at this stage).', 'Information ', 'about Dr. Sohn’s lab at York University can be found at www.yorku.ca/~gsohn. Following Canadian Employment and Immigration guidelines, applicants must be eligible to', 'work in Canada.', 'Reference ID: Postdoc Fellowship in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, SLAM', 'Contract length: 24 months', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Job Types: Full-time, Contract', 'Salary: $60,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year', 'Experience:', 'Deep Learning: 2 years (Preferred)']

['Address:
', '100 King Street West
', 'Job Family Group:
', 'Data Analytics & Reporting
', 'Thank you for your interest in BMO Financial Group. We are currently working towards providing a better candidate experience by including all of our job descriptions in both English and French. In the meantime, if this role is located in Quebec and/or New Brunswick please reference the French job description available below the English version. Otherwise please see the job description below in English as per federal language requirements.', '
', "
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt à l'égard de BMO Groupe financier. Nous travaillons actuellement à offrir une meilleure expérience aux candidats en publiant toutes nos descriptions de poste en français et en anglais. Entre-temps, si ce poste est affiché au Québec ou au Nouveau-Brunswick, veuillez consulter la description de poste en français disponible sous la version anglaise. Autrement, veuillez consulter la description de poste ci-dessous en anglais, conformément aux exigences fédérales en matière de langues.
", 'Summary:
', '
Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (ML and AI) is a strategic initiative in risk management. The candidate will participate in new projects and be hands-on along side internal experts. The candidate will have a concrete and meaningful contribution to the final deliverables and is expect to show autonomy and ownership of their deliverables.
', '
', '
The candidate will be responsible for identifying AI and ML use cases in the Risk Capital and Model Development group and building these models in partnership with the existing team. This will cover multiple areas such as Anti-Money Laundering, Credit Risk, Economic Capital etc.
', '
', '
The candidate will also be working on identifying automation opportunities where existing processes can be enhanced and simplified using AI.
', '
', '
The role also has a technology component where the candidate will participate in the assessment of the current risk technology stack and test and validate assumptions on new tools.
', '
', '
', 'Description:
', '
', 'Use case identification:
', 'Expand on the currently identified use cases by partnering with the existing model development groups and the business partners and identify other types of models/applications where ML and AI can add value. This will cover areas such as credit risk, economic capital, AML and market risk.
', '
Structure above identified use cases, define operating model, manage delivery and provide
', '
', 'Data collection and manipulation
', 'Collect data for model development purposes by identifying new candidate variables and predictive variables.
', '
Analyze and summarize data to identify outliers and assess data quality.
', '
Perform data imputation using advanced statistical techniques (multiple imputation, machine learning estimations).
', '
Transform and prepare the data for developing AI models.
', '
', 'Predictive models development
', 'Fully understand the existing version of the models where applicable, their limitations and all the underlying assumptions made.
', '
Use the prepared data to build machine learning predictive models using advanced regression techniques such as random forests, neural networks, boosted trees, deep learning, logistic regressions, NLP etc
', '
Rank and compare the candidate models to select the best fitting models.
', '
Use statistical tests to ensure the stability and robustness of the candidate models.
', '
Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning in the current model development process.
', '
', 'Reasonableness assessment
', 'Ensure that the models developed make business and intuitive sense by participating in sessions with the model owners, lines of businesses and including their feedback in the model.
', '
Design a process to explain the output of the models on a consistent basis to understand why the models are producing these decisions.
', '
', 'Documentation
', 'Document the process along the way by capturing the details around all assumptions made.
', '
Keep record and detailed notes about the thought process. The models developed will serve as a proof of concept for future ML & AI models in credit risk.', '
', '
Skills required:
', '
Master or PhD candidate in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related quantitative field.
', '
5-10 years of experience in AML, risk management and machine learning and AI techniques
', '
Familiarity with risk management processes and methodologies, ideally AML
', '
Familiarity with Bank credit instruments and product structures
', '
Familiarity with systems management and data architecture principles
', '
Experience with statistical model development and data mining
', '
Proven experience using SAS, R or Python to build machine learning models
', '
Strong theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques and advanced regression methods and data imputation techniques
', '
Well-developed relationship management skills.
', '
Excellent influencing and negotiation skills
', '
Strong problem solving skills and capacity to turnaround analysis in short period of time
', '
Comfortable in a challenging environment with tight timelines
', '
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
', '
Capacity to cope with a high degree of ambiguity and change
', '
Ability to work both independently and as part of cross-functional teams
', '
Prior industry experience or academic projects with machine learning and advanced programming is preferred.
', '
High-level of competency with MS Office suite of tools
', 'We’re here to help
', '
', '
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
', '
', '
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
', '
', '
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
', '
', '
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.']

['At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.', '
', '
Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.', '
', '
The Manager Data Integration and Advanced Analytics is a key member of the broader Data Science and Products team and will be responsible for driving project and adhoc based actionable insights to drive key KPI’s. The manager will have a hands on role utilizing a variety of tools SAS, SQL, Python to explore and understand data and provide visualizations (Power BI/ Tableau) to tell key business partners a story with recommended actions to drive outcomes. The data attributes include (but not limited to) revenue, subscribers and product/tier changes which needs to be analysed at different contexts like customer-level analysis and program-level analysis. Hands on working with data to pull data, turn the data into a story that can share insights with business partners to drive key KPI’s is the key part of this role.', '
', '
The role will also be responsible to work with various business partners including Brand and Digital to build Segmentation and audiences using a variety of digital tools including Adobe, Google and AWS product suite.', '
', '
Key Accountabilities:', '
', '
Lead analytical requests for both project and ad-hoc data analytical requests and build comprehensive visualizations (PowerBI and Tableau)
', 'Use SQL, SAS. Python to analyze data from different sources and provide key actionable insights', '
Tell right story to Executives based on data and performed analytics with recommended actions to improve outcomes', '
Act as a key analytics SME to make recommendations for data acquisition and/or analysis requirements and fulfilment for complex process improvement projects', '
Partner with various Rogers Business teams to align business logic to make available consumable qualitative data to drive key KPI’s', '
Lead digital projects for segmentation using Adobe, Google, AWS suite of products', '
', '
Qualifications:', '
', '
7 years hands-on experience in Data Analysis, SAS, SQL programming, Python and Data visualization with the ability to think analytically', '
Strong development and visualization skills (PowerBI, Tableau etc.) and power point presentations that enable leaders understanding of data to provide actionable insights that enables functional leaders in decision making
', 'Strong digital experience working with Adobe, google, AWS data suite of products', '
Understanding of Data Science and feature engineering
', 'Self-motivated person with desire to go above and beyond tasks', '
Being pro-active when it comes to exploring opportunities for growth and improve programs or outcomes', '
Team player with ability to collaborate in cross functional teams and build trust based on the work she/he performs', '
Schedule:', ' Full time', '
Shift:', ' Day', '
Length of Contract:', ' Not Applicable (Regular Position)', '
Work Location: ', '1 Mount Pleasant (083), Toronto, ON', '
Travel Requirements:', ' Up to 10%', '
Posting Category/Function: ', 'Reporting and Analytics & Analyst', '
Requisition ID:', ' 177720', '
', "

', '

["You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self.
